comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: m.webtoons.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://m.webtoons.com/en/romance/be-my-villain/list?title_no=2728](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fm.webtoons.com%2Fen%2Fromance%2Fbe-my-villain%2Flist%3Ftitle_no%3D2728) ### Comment > So for some reason all of a sudden last night Webtoon started getting ads again. There was an ad at the end of each comic, and the New & Hot reappeared again. I didn't change any settings in AdGuard. I was only using the general AdGuard block list before. No other site/app had ads, just Webtoon. Somehow they circumvented ad blocking. I added a handful of new lists to AdGuard including Peter Lowe's, etc., and that helped with the ad at the end of the comic, but there is still the annoying New & Hot as well as pop ups like "buy our coins!!" I'm not sure what happened but the app is way more annoying to use now. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/qaxswspnjo0cs4w80kc00ckwcgss8coam2e56quymw.jpg?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard DNS DNS setup: | Device or router settings DNS server: | Private AdGuard DNS server System version: | `Android 15` Browser: | It's the app Blocklists: | General:
AdGuard DNS,
Peter Lowe's Blocklist,
OISD Blocklist Small,
Dan Pollock's List

comment.body:
> "New & Hot" is not an ad. Ads are blocked.

Some are blocked, not all ads.

issue.title: sports.yahoo.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://sports.yahoo.com/nfl/breaking-news/article/texans-reportedly-trading-wr-john-metchie-to-eagles-ahead-of-season-opener-192126691.html](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fsports.yahoo.com%2Fnfl%2Fbreaking-news%2Farticle%2Ftexans-reportedly-trading-wr-john-metchie-to-eagles-ahead-of-season-opener-192126691.html) ### Comment > Starting today, Yahoo Sports articles do not render when the AdGuard Tracking Protection filter is enabled in uBO. The front page loads (https://sports.yahoo.com) but clicking on any links will briefly show the article then dissapears. Disabling the filter fixes the issue. > > ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/jx80hyon3io8k08s0wsws8s08kkks8kdtprto65ens.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/bo09v6m8zmokwkkc0kgookk04wsgwg0rizd9lvmdtc.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- Platform: | uBO v1.6.5.1b7 System version: | `macOS 15.6` Browser: | Firefox Filters: | Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection Other extensions used: | `uBO`

issue.title: www.paramountplus.com

labels.name: Stale
labels.description: The issue is considered as obsolete

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://www.paramountplus.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.paramountplus.com)
### Comment
> When using Paramount plus on my Roku I can't play any shows.  I just get a spinning wheel.  If I point to another public DNS server it works fine.  This just started for me about a week ago.  There are Reddit post from other users showing similar issues 

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/8pgknqksoi4ocoskwwcg4ssosks04oklvp9zkv5qk0.png?nc=1)
</details>
<details>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/7do3coahig00okkwokkw4sks0kck0807b2oejhnfgw.png?nc=1)
</details>

Information | Value
--- | ---
AdGuard product: | AdGuard DNS

DNS server: | AdGuard DNS Default server

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 10 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: www.alltrails.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.alltrails.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.alltrails.com%2F) ### Comment > **Steps to reproduce:** > 1. Enable AdGuard in browser (reproducible in both Firefox and Safari) > 2. Attempt to login **using Google** to alltrails.com > > **Expected result:** > AllTrails website is logged in, using the chosen Google account. > > **Actual result:** > AllTrails website is _not_ logged in. Developer console (Firefox) shows this CORS error: > > > Cross-Origin Request Blocked: The Same Origin Policy disallows reading the remote resource at https://play.google.com/log?format=json&hasfast=true&authuser=0. (Reason: CORS request did not succeed). Status code: (null). > ``` Username: @pmonks ``` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/khyc2kx88hs0ks44o4kcksk88c40kcoe30sfa5npbs.png?nc=1)

Block trackers,

The front page loads (https://sports.yahoo.com) but clicking on any links will briefly show the article then dissapears. Disabling the filter fixes the issue. > > ### Screenshots
